intro: Dianthus incertus, commonly known as the uncertain carnation, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family, which includes other well-known genera like Dianthus and Silene. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring upright stems and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers have five petals that are often slightly notched at the edges. Dianthus incertus is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, temperate climates.
